text: On tap. It poured an amber color with a beige head. The aroma was of malts, nuts, caramel and pine. The taste was similar to the aroma with more malts, nuts, caramel, pine and some hops. Tasty.

Pours hazy yellow with ample white head. Aroma is malty with a pungent yeast backbone. Flavor is smooth and rounded with a hint of fruity floral hops.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12/8/16. 12oz can... cant remember where from. Habersham, maybe? Golden pour with a small white head. Light grassy aroma, hay, pale malts. Light flavor, pale malts, grainy, hay, grass. Not bad.

12 oz can. It pours a pale golden color with a medium sized long lasting white head. It has the aroma of hay & bread with hints of resin. It has a nice clean pilsner taste with a nice hop bitterness. I taste hay, bread and pine. This is a very good beer. Im glad I bought it.

- bräunliches Bernstein mit fast keiner Schaumbildung
- leichte Aromen nach Trockenfrüchten, Erde, Malz und etwas Honig
- fast keine Carbonisierung
- der Antrunk wirkt durch die minimale Kohlensäurebeigabe leicht schal und 
 abgestanden
- der ganze Verlauf hat eine seltsame Wässrigkeit, welche das Geschmacks-
 erlebnis völlig trübt
- geschmackstechnisch wirkt irgendwie nur das röstige Malz als etwas belebendes Element
Fazit: Schales Gesöff
Can. Pours a transparent golden with a thick layer of creamy head. Aroma and taste of crisp malts and some hoppiness.
Draught at the Hilton downtown Atlanta. One of three draught pours. Sweet caramel amber.

Pours up a crystal clear deep gold amber color, with a fluffy white head. Aroma is fruity hops with a yeast component. The flavor is malty, but has plenty of fruity hops to balance it out. Clean slightly dry finish. Soft carbonation with smooth medium body. Over all great stuff.

12 fl.oz bottle with 5.3 abv. Pours clear dark amber colour with a small good lasting beige head. Aroma of toasted malt, nuts, caramel, red fruits and pine. Taste of hazelnuts, caramel, mild bitter hops, some red fruits, very good!

On tap at the brewery in their new Laughing Skull glass.
Pours golden-amber color; clear, with a decent white head. 

Near medium body with crisp carbonation and a dry finish.

Aroma; fruity Calypso hops with some bread.

The flavor follows but is more Hoppy than expected for style; this lives up to the promise of a very flavorful lager.
